summary: A more whiter & realistic HD retextures for the Dragonplate Armor in Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/33563-3-1365283267.png[/img]

[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/33563-1-1367408418.jpg[/img]


[size=4]HD whiter & realistic retextures for the Dragonplate Armor found in Skyrim. Also you get free seam fixes seen and visible in-game on the Dragonplate Shield through the textures themselves without needing mesh/uv edits.[/size]

[img]http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7454/8845736532_383a588c2c_c_d.jpg[/img]

[img]http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3696/8845102533_867034f8ac_c_d.jpg[/img]



[/center]
[center][img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/33563-5-1365283267.png[/img]
[size=3][b]Skyrim[/b][/size]
[/center]


[center]
[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/33563-4-1365283267.png[/img]


[size=4][b]Texture Comparison:[/b][/size]
[img]http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2819/8845710320_787897ede5_c_d.jpg[/img]

[size=4][b]Texture Comparison:[/b][/size]
[img]http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2821/8845705072_9e55f7d109_c_d.jpg[/img]

[size=4][b]Vanilla Seam Issues: (Mainly caused by the mesh being picky about a certain normal map)[/b][/size]
[img]http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5338/8845081873_2d91eb4a96_c_d.jpg[/img]

[size=4][b]Includes back & front shield seam fixes:[/b][/size]
[img]http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2840/8845078067_5e4cc65fe5_c_d.jpg[/img]


[/center]
[center][img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/33563-2-1365283267.png[/img][/center]
[size=3][b]Special Notes:[/b][/size]
The best comparison is looking at the texture files themselves which is why I always provide some of them for preview.

A bit more realistic retexture, that my retextures are whiter
and more definition can be seen on closer view of the armor mainly on the
dragon bone material and on further distances (depending on your current
mipmap rendering settings for your own game) you\'ll get a smoother less 
defined look, this is achieved by utilizing different blurred mipmap levels.

[size=3][b]Installing:[/b][/size]
Choose a replacer from a directory and copy the \"Data\\\" folder provided in the archive to your
Skyrim\\Data directory.

Overwrite any other files when prompted.

[size=3][b]Uninstalling:[/b][/size]
Trace back to the contents of the archive and delete what you have previously added to your Skyrim\\Data directory.

[center]
